steps: Run 'notify setup' command
Verify list of available providers is displayed
Verify providers can be selected with arrow keys
Verify providers can be selected by entering a number

description: Telegram provider setup asks for bot token and default recipient
steps: Run 'notify setup' and select Telegram provider
Verify bot token is requested as a secure input
Verify default recipient is requested as optional input
Verify credentials are saved to providers/telegram/secret.json

description: Telegram send message to default recipient
steps: Configure Telegram provider with default recipient
Run 'notify telegram <message>'
Verify message is sent to default recipient
Verify log entry is created with datetime and message

description: Telegram send message without default recipient throws error
steps: Configure Telegram provider without default recipient
Run 'notify telegram <message>'
Verify error is thrown indicating default recipient not set

description: Telegram send message to specific recipient
steps: Configure Telegram provider
Run 'notify telegram <recipient> <message>'
Verify message is sent to specified recipient
Verify log entry is created with datetime, recipient and message

description: Log command shows all notification history
steps: Send multiple notifications through different providers
Run 'notify log'
Verify all notifications are displayed with datetime
Verify notifications show provider, recipient and message
Send notifications through multiple providers
Run 'notify log telegram'
Verify only Telegram notifications are displayed
Verify other provider logs are not shown

description: Telegram command fails gracefully when provider not configured
steps: Ensure Telegram provider is not configured
Run 'notify telegram <message>'
Verify user-friendly error message is displayed
Verify suggestion to run setup is shown
Run 'notify setup'
Enter an invalid provider number
Verify error message is displayed
Verify user is prompted to try again
Run setup and configure a provider
Verify secret.json file is created in providers directory
Verify file contains the entered credentials
Verify sensitive data is not logged

description: Logs are persisted in JSONL format
steps: Send a notification
Verify logs.jsonl file exists in installation directory
Verify log entry is valid JSON
Verify log contains timestamp, provider, recipient and message
Run 'notify --help'
Verify available commands are listed
Verify command descriptions are displayed
Verify usage examples are shown
Run 'npm install -g' in project directory
Verify 'notify' command is available globally
Run 'notify --version'
Verify version number is displayed
